name: Roy Kim
description:
'''Kim Sang-woo''' ({{Korean|hangul=김상우}}; born July 3, 1993), known professionally as '''Roy Kim''' ({{Korean|hangul=로이킴}}), is a South Korean singer-songwriter and radio presenter. He began his singing career after winning the television talent show ''[[Superstar K 4]]'' in 2012.

Kim officially debuted with the studio album, ''[[Love Love Love (Roy Kim album)|Love Love Love]]'' (2013), which included the hit single "Bom Bom Bom." The album garnered Kim awards for best new artist at the [[2013 Mnet Asian Music Awards|15th Mnet Asian Music Awards]] and the 2014 [[Golden Disc Awards]]. Kim followed up his first album with the studio albums, ''[[Home (Roy Kim album)|Home]]'' (2014) and ''[[The Great Dipper (album)|The Great Dipper]]'' (2015), and the extended play, ''Blooming Season'' (2017). He has also contributed to soundtracks for television series including ''[[Reply 1994]]'', ''[[Pinocchio (2014 TV series)|Pinocchio]]'', ''[[Another Miss Oh]],'' and ''[[Guardian: The Lonely and Great God]]''. As of {{CURRENTMONTHNAME}} {{CURRENTYEAR}}, Kim has sold over 12 million [[Music download|digital downloads]] in his native country (see [[Roy Kim discography]]).
